programme.title: Sur le front
programme.desc:
Medicines: a time bomb
Why are certain common illnesses increasingly difficult to treat? Where are our medicine manufactured? Can they really be recycled? How to invent tomorrow's treatments? Hugo Clément investigates the rivers polluted by drug residues and the problem of multiresistant bacteria.
Directed by: Victor Peressetchensky (France, 2022) With Hugo Clément.

programme.title: Ma vie rurale
programme.desc: Episode 7 Pierre, cattle farmer, might have found someone to take over his Ardèche farm. In the Drôme, Audrey wants to revolutionise traditional truffle-growing methods. Mélanie, a vet in Normandy, is confronted with a TB epidemic that threatens the region's farms. Aurore sets up her travelling grocery store in a small village. Directed by: Frédéric Martin (France, 2021)

programme.title: Embarquement
programme.desc: Braga (Portugal) Braga is one of Portugal's unmissable destinations. Lying in northern part of the country, the city is rich in museums and theatres and offers a wide range of shows throughout the year. Gastronomy and winegrowing also form part of Braga's culture and way of life. Directed by: Antonio Buscardini (Belgium, 2020)

programme.title: C Jamy
programme.desc:
Bread
Who invented bread? How did it become a dietary basic all around the world? What are the secrets of bread-making? Jamy and his gang explain the recipe for success that made bread an all-essential part of our diet. From crust to final crumb, a programme not to be missed...
Presented by: Jamy Gourmaud.

programme.title: De Gaulle, premières batailles
programme.desc:
17 May 1940, Montcornet, in the Aisne. At dawn the tanks of the 4th armoured division attack, commanded by a 49 year-old colonel, Charles de Gaulle. We look back at one of the founding events of the de Gaulle legend and the first major counter-offensive of the Second World War.

Directed by: Serge Tignères (France, 2019)

programme.title: Cuisine ouverte
programme.desc:
In the Côtes d'Armor, with Alan Stivell
Mory Sacko is in the Côtes d'Armor. Where better to rediscover that typical Breton product: cider, that he'll be using to marinate his plantain. At his side, the Breton musician Alan Stivell.
Presented by: Mory Sacko.

programme.title: Les maîtres de la peinture moderne
programme.desc: Maurice Utrillo Fils de l'artiste peintre Suzanne Valadon, Maurice Utrillo commence à travailler régulièrement à partir de 1910 et produit des centaines de toiles en plusieurs décennies. Emblématique de l'École de Paris, cette personnalité très tourmentée représente essentiellement des paysages dans lesquels apparaissent souvent des maisons, des coins de villages. Réalisation : Jacques Vichet (France, 2019)

programme.title: Visite d'État du roi Charles III en France
programme.desc:
Special edition on the occasion of the first state visit of King Charles III to France. Julian Bugier and his guests talk about this visit and the ceremony organised at the Arc de Triomphe in Paris, in the presence of President Emmanuel Macron and the Queen consort Camilla.
Presenter: Julian Bugier. Director: Fabien Sarfati (France, 2023)

programme.title: Curieuse de nature dans les îles
programme.desc: Le cobra au Sahara (Maroc) Aussi discret que méconnu, le cobra est la star malheureuse de la place Jemaa el-Fnaa à Marrakech. Sans ses glandes à venins et ses crochets, il ne survit jamais à son exposition au public. Avec Abdellah Bouazza, nous cherchons ce bel animal sous les pierres chauffées à blanc du désert. Présentation : Myriam Baran. Réalisation : Nicolas Brikké (Saison 4, France, 2019)

programme.title: Cuisine ouverte
programme.desc:
In the Côtes d'Armor, with Alan Stivell
Mory Sacko is in the Côtes d'Armor. Where better to rediscover that typical Breton product: cider, that he'll be using to marinate his plantain. At his side, the Breton musician Alan Stivell.
Presented by: Mory Sacko.

programme.title: La librairie francophone
programme.sub-title: Hélène Dorion, Patrice Leconte, Philippe Besson, Julia Sarr

programme.title: Faut pas rêver
programme.desc:
Between Saint-Tropez and the Calanques

From the summer influx of yachts in Saint-Tropez, to one of the world's greatest regattas, from the hills of Canjuers to unique beers, such as one flavoured with mimosa from the Var, and vertiginous dives into the rocky Calanques: a journey through the Midi, to the rhythm of the seasons.

Presented by: Carolina De Salvo.

programme.title: Regarde-moi
programme.desc:
Lofti, a Tunisian immigrant in his forties, living in Marseille, divides his time between his electrical goods store and his French girlfriend who's pregnant. But when his ex-wife has a stroke, he suddenly finds himself responsible their young son, Amr, 9 years-old and autistic. A child he's never known...

Directed by:Nejib Belkadhi (Tunisia, 2017)

Cast: Nidhal Saadi, Idryss Kharroubi, Saoussen Maalej

Genre: Dramedy

programme.title: Une autre histoire
programme.desc:
Episode 21
Called by her boss for an emergency, Anémone forgets what she was doing in the house, which worries her daughters. Ron, still in hospital, receives an unexpected visit. Caroline, Sébastien and Jean-Olivier learn more about their mother's past.
Directed by: Brigitte Couture (Canada, 2019) Cast: Marina Orsini (Anémone), Danielle Proulx (Lise), Sébastien Ricard (Vincent), Debbie Lynch-White (Caroline), Benoît McGinnis (Sébastien), Adam Kosh (Jean-Olivier), Mikhaïl Ahooja (Simon), Marilou Morin (Karla), Laurence Barrette (Olivia) Genre: drama

programme.title: Une autre histoire
programme.desc:
Episode 22
Anémone is surprised to learn that Lise is at Karla's beside. Is it time to mend the bridges with her best friend? She also makes a move towards Sophie, who she sees in a very different light since the revelations made by the latter.
Directed by: Brigitte Couture (Canada, 2019) Cast: Marina Orsini (Anémone), Danielle Proulx (Lise), Sébastien Ricard (Vincent), Debbie Lynch-White (Caroline), Benoît McGinnis (Sébastien), Adam Kosh (Jean-Olivier), Mikhaïl Ahooja (Simon), Marilou Morin (Karla), Laurence Barrette (Olivia) Genre: drama

programme.title: Jean de La Fontaine, l'homme qui aimait les fables
programme.desc: Readers seemingly never tire of the gaiety and modernity of the "Fables" by Jean de La Fontaine (1621-1695). Updated in 1668, these texts have always been illustrated by artists, with striking images which help reveal the fable writer'spersonality. Director: Pascale Bouhénic (France, 2021)
